quest.name: Snouts Down, Tails Up
journal: Hilda has a letter for you from Rostnsthal.

Hilda hands you a letter from Rostnsthal. The note informs you that the bandit leader's firearm is of Lominsan construction, and bids you travel to the maritime city to help investigate how the strictly regulated weapon ended up in the thief's hands. Make your way to the aetheryte plaza in Limsa Lominsa, and seek out your fellow instructor.

Rostnsthal has narrowed down the potential suppliers to a single merchant─the very same trader who escaped the Hounds back in Boulder Downs. Find the black marketeer at the Anchor Yard, and aid Rostnsthal and Hilda with the interrogation.

After a healthy dose of intimidation from Rostnsthal, the merchant reveals the existence of a hidden bandit camp at Providence Point. Travel to the Coerthas central highlands, and track down the bandit leader.
You have located the bandit leader and defeated his beastly protectors. It is time to wring the full story from the cornered fugitive...

After interrogating the bandit leader and learning the details of the theft, you become aware that the events leading to Hrunting's reclamation may have been deliberately orchestrated. Return to Ishgard, and raise your concerns with Ser Muscadain at the Congregation of Our Knights Most Heavenly.

Initially bemused by Hilda's unexpected visit, Ser Muscadain is nevertheless persuaded to release Hrunting to the manufactory for a more thorough examination. Her mission successful, Hilda bids you follow her back to the Brume.

Though somewhat surprised by Ser Muscadain's accommodating attitude, Hilda seems pleased to know that Lord Stephanivien will be examining the blade. You have naught to do now but await the chief machinist's report, and prepare to act against the true instigator of this crime...

※The next machinist quest will be available from Hilda upon reaching level 70.
objectives: Speak with Rostnsthal in Limsa Lominsa.
Search for the bandit leader at Providence Point.
Speak with Ser Muscadain at the Congregation of Our Knights Most Heavenly.

dialogue.name: HILDA
dialogue.text: Where've you been, Forename? I've been itchin' to open this letter from Rostnsthal, but he's addressed it to you. Come on, let's hear what he has to say!

dialogue.name: ROSTNSTHAL
dialogue.text: (-Letter from Rostnsthal-)Mystery solved. I took a good look at Naldiq & Vymelli's stock, and the firearm's one of theirs.

dialogue.name: ROSTNSTHAL
dialogue.text: (-Letter from Rostnsthal-)Limsa has some bloody strict regulations on the export of firearms, so our bandit chief must've had a back-alley supplier.

dialogue.name: ROSTNSTHAL
dialogue.text:
(-Letter from Rostnsthal-)Get your arse to Limsa Lominsa, and we'll find out who put that weapon in our thief's hands. I'll be at the aetheryte on the lower decks.

Rostnsthal

dialogue.name: HILDA
dialogue.text: So he's on the trail, then? Good. Just let me get my gear and we can be off.

dialogue.name: SYMME
dialogue.text: Wha─ You're going with Forename? Is that really a good idea...?

dialogue.name: EUDESTAND
dialogue.text: I'm with Symme on this one, Hilda. If the leader of the Hounds starts pickin' quarrels on foreign soil, we could be lookin' at all sorts of trouble for Ishgard.

dialogue.name: HILDA
dialogue.text: Ishgard's where the bloody trouble started! And since when have folk of the Brume been content to sit back and let others handle the dirty work!?

dialogue.name: HILDA
dialogue.text: I'm goin' and that's the end of it. But I promise I'll be on my best behavior!

dialogue.name: SYMME
dialogue.text: Once our Hilda sights her target, she's not one to question pulling the trigger...

dialogue.name: EUDESTAND
dialogue.text: There's no arguin' with Hilda when she gets like this. Usually we just try to watch her back, but that'll have to be your job while you're in Limsa.

dialogue.name: HILDA
dialogue.text: Don't you listen to them two─I'm perfectly capable of bein' reasonable. And besides, I'm sure Rostnsthal'll be glad to have me along!

dialogue.name: HILDA
dialogue.text: ...What's that sour look for, then?

dialogue.name: ROSTNSTHAL
dialogue.text: What in the bloody hells is she doin' here? I put your bleedin' name on the letter an' all...

dialogue.name: HILDA
dialogue.text: I need to see this through; if I don't, then what're the Hounds good for? You'll just have to humor me.

dialogue.name: ROSTNSTHAL
dialogue.text: I was aimin' to avoid political complications, seein' as Forename an' me ain't tied too tightly to any one nation... Yer just lucky I've a soft spot for fools what ignore the risks to make a point.

dialogue.name: ROSTNSTHAL
dialogue.text: Let's get to it, then. The bloke most likely to 'ave supplied that firearm is the same bastard what tried to buy the sword: our black marketeer friend.

dialogue.name: ROSTNSTHAL
dialogue.text: If we're lucky, he might 'ave an idea o' where the brigand's run off to. I've a mind to squeeze 'im until an answer pops out.

dialogue.name: HILDA
dialogue.text: Aye, I'd like to have a word or two with that bandit leader, myself. He's a loose end what needs tyin' up.

dialogue.name: ROSTNSTHAL
dialogue.text: Then we're on the same page. Accordin' to me sources, we should find the merchant in the Anchor Yard─let's get over there an' get this business over with.

dialogue.name: HILDA
dialogue.text: As far as I'm concerned, this ain't over till we've got that bandit in chains. And I hate leavin' a job half-finished.

dialogue.name: HILDA
dialogue.text: Good day to you, master merchant. How about we have us a little chat, eh?

dialogue.name: ROSTNSTHAL
dialogue.text: Ye ain't gettin' away this time, matey. Best start talkin' afore I start cuttin'.

dialogue.name: BLACKMARKETEER02908
dialogue.text: W-Well, if it isn't th-the...the Hounds, was it? What can a humble peddler such as myself do for Ishgard's finest?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Tell us where the bandit leader is hiding.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Help us capture the bandit leader.

dialogue.name: BLACKMARKETEER02908
dialogue.text: For a man in my trade, no commodity is more valuable than discretion! If I were to disclose such information, my customers would cease to trus─

dialogue.name: BLACKMARKETEER02908
dialogue.text: I am but a humble merchant. Surely I would be more hindrance than help in such an investig─

dialogue.name: ROSTNSTHAL
dialogue.text: If yer not feelin' helpful, then maybe I should pay a visit to the Yellowjackets an' mention the firearm yer valued customer was usin'. ...Or maybe I'll just skip straight to them as upholds the code.

dialogue.name: BLACKMARKETEER02908
dialogue.text: N-Now let us not be too hasty! Mayhap I can make an exception in this case, in exchange for your silence regarding my, uh, trade in exotic weapons.

dialogue.name: BLACKMARKETEER02908
dialogue.text: I believe the gentleman in question has a camp at Providence Point in the central highlands. That is where I would look.

dialogue.name: HILDA
dialogue.text: Providence Point, eh? Well, it's a start.

dialogue.name: ROSTNSTHAL
dialogue.text: If yer playin' us false, I'll be back to feed the crabs with yer lyin' tongue. In fact, if I ever 'ear o' ye dealin' in stolen goods again, ye can add a few more body parts to that list. Nice doin' business with ye.

dialogue.name: HILDA
dialogue.text: More of them guard beasts came at me, but I put 'em down easily enough. Rostnsthal's drills must be payin' off.

dialogue.name: ROSTNSTHAL
dialogue.text: These curs were trained. Seems our merchant was tellin' the truth about there bein' a camp 'ereabouts.

dialogue.name: BLACKMARKETEER02908
dialogue.text:
Never accept a deal from a client you know naught about! But that woman offered me so much gold, I ignored my own rule.
<sigh> Mayhap it is time I retired from this business...

dialogue.name: ROBBERLEADER02908
dialogue.text:
What!? How did ye─
Bah, ye've signed yer own death warrant comin' here!

dialogue.name: ROBBERLEADER02908
dialogue.text: Gods, no! Ye've killed me precious...

dialogue.name: HILDA
dialogue.text: I came runnin' when I heard the shots, but it seems you had things well in hand.

dialogue.name: ROBBERLEADER02908
dialogue.text: Oh, bugger me, there's more of ye. Please, I'll do anythin' ye ask...just don't kill me!

dialogue.name: ROSTNSTHAL
dialogue.text: Stop yer blubberin', cur, we ain't goin' to kill ye...not just yet, anyroad. That'll depend on the answers ye give us.

dialogue.name: HILDA
dialogue.text: Answers? What's he on about, Forename?

dialogue.name: Q2
dialogue.text: What answer is Rostnsthal looking for?

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: The reason behind Hrunting's theft.

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: The identity of the bandit's employer.

dialogue.name: HILDA
dialogue.text: They wanted to sell it for coin, of cour─ Ah. But then why only steal the sword, eh?

dialogue.name: HILDA
dialogue.text: Wait, it weren't that black market bloke? ...Hm, I guess he'd have wanted more than just the sword, eh?

dialogue.name: HILDA
dialogue.text: Them other brigands we captured were bloody clueless. They only knew what the job was─not the who or the why.

dialogue.name: ROSTNSTHAL
dialogue.text: Meanin' the whole deal was made through this bastard. Start barkin', dog, an' ye might just save yer own 'ide.

dialogue.name: ROBBERLEADER02908
dialogue.text: We...we was pirates once─that is until the bitch Admiral passed her bloody law. Blokes like us, though, we ain't cut out for “honest” work.

dialogue.name: ROBBERLEADER02908
dialogue.text: We'd almost drunk through the last of our plunder when that back-alley peddler showed up with some overpainted wench. Said she'd a job for us.

dialogue.name: ROBBERLEADER02908
dialogue.text: All we had to do was filch a special sword from the Holy See. Hah! For the purse she offered, we'd have stolen the whole bleedin' vault.

dialogue.name: HILDA
dialogue.text: And who was this woman?

dialogue.name: ROBBERLEADER02908
dialogue.text: Part o' the deal was we didn't ask no questions. Even the merchant didn't know her real name. It was odd, aye, but we needed the coin an' I didn't rightly care either way.

dialogue.name: ROBBERLEADER02908
dialogue.text: The job itself was easy as takin' a piss. She even paid for me to have a firearm to use, an' sent us down a route where we didn't see no guards─though the gods only know how she managed that trick.

dialogue.name: ROBBERLEADER02908
dialogue.text: All we did was follow her map, then shoot the locks on the vault. Walked in, grabbed the sword, walked out. Bold as ye please. The trouble came after the delivery was made...

dialogue.name: ROSTNSTHAL
dialogue.text: She gave the blade back to you.

dialogue.name: ROBBERLEADER02908
dialogue.text: Aye. She sent for me again the day after. Pushed the sword back into me hand along with a sack full o' coin.

dialogue.name: ROBBERLEADER02908
dialogue.text: Said she'd made a mistake or summat, an' that I should sell the damn thing. Well, I ain't fool enough to try fencin' a relic like that on me own, so I went back to the merchant...

dialogue.name: HILDA
dialogue.text: You were fool enough not to properly burn your contract of sale. How do you think we found you the first time?

dialogue.name: ROBBERLEADER02908
dialogue.text: Contract o' sale? What in the hells are ye talkin' about? Ye think I'd leave a deal like that in ink for the whole world to see!?

dialogue.name: ROSTNSTHAL
dialogue.text: ...Things are startin' to make sense now. There's just one little problem with yer story.

dialogue.name: ROBBERLEADER02908
dialogue.text: I've told ye the truth, I swear! It was that wench what put us up to it!

dialogue.name: ROSTNSTHAL
dialogue.text: Aye, that bit I believe. What catches in me craw is her reason for handin' back the sword. That was no mistake. An' us findin' that contract o' sale this bastard says 'e never wrote was no mistake neither.

dialogue.name: HILDA
dialogue.text: No...we was led by the nose to reclaim Hrunting before it was sold. And the quickest way to learn the why of it might be to ask the blade itself. Would you mind cartin' this piece of offal back to Ishgard, Rostnsthal?

dialogue.name: HILDA
dialogue.text: Come with me, Forename. We need to pay us a visit to Muscadain, and convince him to take a closer look at that sword.

dialogue.name: HILDA
dialogue.text: To be honest, I ain't all that eager to talk to that blue-blooded bastard, but I suppose we all have to make sacrifices. Let's head over to the Congregation.

dialogue.name: ROSTNSTHAL
dialogue.text: I'll take care o' this pissant; ye just concern yerself with inspectin' that sword.

dialogue.name: ROBBERLEADER02908
dialogue.text: If it weren't for that witch Merlwyb an' her shite-eatin' law, I'd still be sailin' free on the high seas...

dialogue.name: MUSCADAIN
dialogue.text: MistressMaster Forename, how may I...ah. You again. Was there some choice insult you'd forgotten to spit at me during our previous meeting?

dialogue.name: HILDA
dialogue.text: Truce, Muscadain. I wouldn't be here if it weren't important.

dialogue.name: MUSCADAIN
dialogue.text: I see. So you believe that Hrunting may have been altered in some fashion before you were “allowed” to reclaim it?

dialogue.name: HILDA
dialogue.text: It's a bit too bloody convenient, don't you think? Maybe I'm wrong, but I'd rather look the fool than risk summat happenin' at the ceremony. We need to check that sword!

dialogue.name: MUSCADAIN
dialogue.text: I must admit, your passion confounds me. The blade is recovered and your Hounds have done their duty. Why bother pursuing such a faint suspicion? Why willingly endure the presence of a man you so clearly despise?

dialogue.name: HILDA
dialogue.text: Oh, aye, I hate your bleedin' guts. But once we take on a job, we do the damn thing right!

dialogue.name: HILDA
dialogue.text: Forename gave herhis all to save Ishgard. How could I look herhim in the eye if I let our petty feud get in the way of my duty!

dialogue.name: MUSCADAIN
dialogue.text: ...Such pride. I've not seen this side of you before.

dialogue.name: MUSCADAIN
dialogue.text: It is as you say. If there truly is some flaw or trickery in the blade that disrupts the ceremony, the consequences could be grave indeed.

dialogue.name: MUSCADAIN
dialogue.text: And yet there are rules in place which prevent me from simply handing Hrunting over to the Hounds. Furthermore, our resident blacksmith has already inspected the recovered weapon and declared it sound.

dialogue.name: HILDA
dialogue.text: Even so, we should─

dialogue.name: MUSCADAIN
dialogue.text: Even so, I will call upon Lord Stephanivien to conduct an independent examination. A machinist may notice a detail that a blacksmith would overlook. I trust this can be accomplished with the requisite discretion?

dialogue.name: MUSCADAIN
dialogue.text: Very good. As far as the release of Hrunting is concerned, the manufactory is a sanctioned facility. The bureaucrats will be satisfied even should I secure the necessary permissions after the fact. I shall begin making the arrangements.

dialogue.name: HILDA
dialogue.text: Well...that's that, then. Let's get back to the Brume and tell the news to Rostnsthal.

dialogue.name: SYMME
dialogue.text: Back then, are you? I don't rightly know what the story was with that sword, but Hilda seems happy with what we did...and that's good enough for me!

dialogue.name: EUDESTAND
dialogue.text: Lord Stephanivien will get to the bottom of this, you see if he doesn't. Best thing we can do is get back to our drills and leave him to it.

dialogue.name: ROSTNSTHAL
dialogue.text: Keep one 'and near yer weapon, Forename. Me gut says this business ain't over by a long shot...

dialogue.name: HILDA
dialogue.text: Muscadain's not known for his love of the lowborn. I didn't expect he'd just... I thought I'd have to put up more of a fight, is what I'm sayin'.

dialogue.name: HILDA
dialogue.text: Well, the sword's with the manufactory now, so I've no complaints─that's where I'd meant to take it in the first place. Now we wait.

dialogue.name: HILDA
dialogue.text: But don't get too comfortable, Forename. Things are sure to come to a head soon enough...
